name: Chinese Scallion Pancakes
author: Mei
summary: Scallion pancakes are a popular dish in China, and available from restaurants and street vendors. There are many different regional variations. My version is Shanghai-style and is my grandmother's recipe. These can be frozen after step 3, and thawed and finished cooking when ready to eat.
ingredients: ½ cup cold water, or as needed
vegetable oil, or as needed, divided
directions: Mix flour and 1 teaspoon salt together in a large bowl; pour in boiling water and quickly mix together until water is absorbed
Work cold water, about 1 tablespoon at a time, into flour mixture just until dough forms
Cover bowl with a damp cloth and let dough rest for 40 minutes
Turn dough onto a lightly floured work surface; divide into 4 equal pieces
Roll 1 piece of dough into a large thin round; brush the top with vegetable oil and sprinkle with about 1/2 teaspoon salt and 1/4 the green onions
Pick up 1 end of the round and roll dough around green onions into a long scroll-shape
Take 1 scroll end and roll dough into a disk
Repeat with remaining dough, letting each disk rest for 10 minutes
Heat about 1 tablespoon vegetable oil in a skillet over medium-low heat
Place 1 disk on a floured surface and roll into a 1/2-inch thick round; cook in the hot oil until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes per side
